materials.raw_text:
K2 (Potassium) - 20 g
P4 (Phosphorus) - 10 g
S12 (Sulfur) - 12 g
Tm2 (Thulium) - 5 g
Binder (e.g., epoxy resin) - 50 g

sourcing.instructions:
K2 - Chemical supply stores or online chemical distributors
P4 - Specialty chemical suppliers
S12 - Chemical supply stores
Tm2 - Rare earth material suppliers
Binder - Hardware stores or craft supply shops
steps: K2 - Chemical supply stores or online chemical distributors
Binder - Hardware stores or craft supply shops
1. In a clean, dry container, measure 20 g of K2.
2. Add 10 g of P4 and mix thoroughly with a spatula.
3. Gradually introduce 12 g of S12, ensuring an even distribution.
4. Finally, add 5 g of Tm2 and stir until the mixture is homogeneous.
5. Slowly incorporate 50 g of the binder while stirring to achieve a uniform paste.
preparation.raw_text:
1. In a clean, dry container, measure 20 g of K2.
2. Add 10 g of P4 and mix thoroughly with a spatula.
3. Gradually introduce 12 g of S12, ensuring an even distribution.
4. Finally, add 5 g of Tm2 and stir until the mixture is homogeneous.
5. Slowly incorporate 50 g of the binder while stirring to achieve a uniform paste.

cooling.raw_text: After heating, turn off the oven and allow the container to cool gradually to room temperature (approximately 30 minutes) to avoid thermal shock.

2. Inspect for any surface imperfections and sand down rough edges as necessary.
